TextBlock.Text: CASSAVA: I have observed the deadly matter on this planet consistently rising as the <color=lightblue>Attlerock</color> orbits overhead.
CASSAVA: Hypothesis: the deadly matter obeys, and can be competitively manipulated by sources of gravity.
CASSAVA: This property of attraction would explain why the deadly matter appears to stay low to the surface of planets, or anchored along surfaces powered by artificial gravity.
CASSAVA: If this hypothesis is true, much of the matter should be drawn over time towards the planets in the star system - as well as the sun, the gravitational center of the system.
CASSAVA: But with their planets indefinitely irradiated by this deadly matter, countless species will surely be eradicated, if they did not already perish by its arrival..
CASSAVA: I can only be grateful for the survival of those that were protected.. As well as the chance to learn what I can about this deadly matter.
